properties.name: Grand Canyon National Park
properties.description: Mile-deep canyon carved by Colorado River with stratified rock spanning 2 billion years

properties.name: Yellowstone National Park
properties.description: World's first national park with half of Earth's geothermal features including Old Faithful

properties.name: Yosemite National Park
properties.description: Granite cliffs, giant sequoias, and iconic waterfalls including El Capitan and Half Dome

properties.name: Monument Valley
properties.description: Iconic sandstone buttes on Navajo land, the quintessential American West landscape

properties.name: Antelope Canyon
properties.description: World-famous slot canyon with dramatic light beams, among most photographed places on Earth

properties.name: Tunnel View (Yosemite)
properties.description: Most photographed viewpoint in America framing El Capitan, Half Dome, and Bridalveil Fall

properties.name: Horseshoe Bend
properties.description: Dramatic 1,000-foot overlook of the Colorado River's horseshoe-shaped meander

properties.name: Zion National Park
properties.description: Towering red cliffs and narrow canyons including Angels Landing and The Narrows

properties.name: Bryce Canyon National Park
properties.description: World's largest concentration of hoodoos - colorful erosion-carved stone spires

properties.name: Arches National Park
properties.description: Over 2,000 natural stone arches including the iconic Delicate Arch

properties.name: Death Valley National Park
properties.description: Hottest place on Earth with surreal salt flats, colorful hills, and below-sea-level basin

properties.name: Glacier National Park
properties.description: Crown of the Continent with over 700 lakes and Going-to-the-Sun Road

properties.name: Sequoia National Park
properties.description: Home to the world's largest trees by volume - the giant sequoias

properties.name: Statue of Liberty
properties.description: UNESCO World Heritage icon of freedom welcoming millions to America since 1886

properties.name: Denali (Mount McKinley)
properties.description: North America's highest peak at 20,310 feet with 92-mile scenic drive

properties.name: Niagara Falls (US side)
properties.description: World's second-largest waterfall by volume with dramatic American and Bridal Veil falls

properties.name: Big Sur
properties.description: California's most scenic coastal drive with dramatic cliffs and ocean views

properties.name: Mather Point (Grand Canyon)
properties.description: Premier South Rim viewpoint offering first panoramic views of the Grand Canyon

properties.name: Great Smoky Mountains
properties.description: America's most-visited national park with misty Appalachian peaks and diverse wildlife

properties.name: Acadia National Park
properties.description: Crown jewel of the North Atlantic coast with rugged Maine coastline

properties.name: Joshua Tree National Park
properties.description: Surreal desert landscape where two distinct desert ecosystems meet

properties.name: Canyonlands National Park
properties.description: Dramatic canyons carved by Colorado and Green Rivers near Moab

properties.name: Badwater Basin
properties.description: Lowest point in North America at 282 feet below sea level

properties.name: Continental Divide at Grays Peak
properties.description: Highest point on the Continental Divide of North America at 14,278 feet
